episodes.title: Potential Trouble Source: Why I joined Scientology, and how I became their worst nightmare
episodes.description:
How could anybody join a cult? And how did I go from being Scientology's top recruiter to their number one UK problem?

On March 25th, I gave a talk to about 40 members of the public at the Nightingale Room in Brighton as a guest speaker for the critical thinking group 'Brighthink'. The talk explores my state of mind when I joined Scientology as a teenager in more detail than I've ever shared before, and summarises my journey in (and out) of the world's most controversial 'religion'.

Support Brighthink: https://brighthink.org/
Read more: https://www.scientologybusiness.com

CHAPTERS
0:00 - Brighthinks
03:58 - Introduction
07:34 - Growing up
13:20 - Hope?
17:39 - John Sweeney & BBC Panorama
20:43 - Disconnection
24:27 - Promotion
26:24 - Guilt
27:20 - Leaving
34:18 - Activism
37:36 - Audience Q&A

episodes.title: Let's have a party! Join us in London on March 13th.
episodes.description:
On March 13th, Scientologists across the world will celebrate the birthday of their founder, L. Ron Hubbard, who died in 1986. In November, we gathered at Scientology’s UK headquarters with a clear message: the abuse must stop; On March 13th our message is simple: life is fun on the outside.

We want to show Scientologists there is a community of people to support them if they choose to leave; demonstrate it is possible to be happy outside Scientology and to celebrate life without LRH.

Event information and registration: https://iasprotest.com/march-13th

episodes.title: Cult Bingo: NXIVM vs Scientology with Sarah Edmonson - TSFU Podcast & A Little Bit Culty
episodes.description:
During her time in NXIVM, Sarah Edmonson worked closely with Keith Raniere and was responsible for recruiting new members to the group. After seeing the light, she joined forces with fellow member Mark Vicente and became an integral part in the cult's downfall - documented on HBO series The Vow.

Today, Sarah joins TSFU Podcast host Ashley Richards and I to discuss the similarities between NXIVM and Scientology, play cult bingo and compare our experiences as sales people for two of the world's most well-known coercive groups.

Listen to Sarah's podcast, A Little Bit Culty: https://alittlebitculty.com/

episodes.description:

episodes.title: Branded an SP at 6 years old: Kelli Copter’s Scientology Childhood
episodes.description:
Born and raised in Scientology, @KelliCopter was designated a Suppressive Person and labelled the cause of all her parent's problems at the tender age of 6 years old. Her parents, who were staff members at Scientology's Manchester Org, regularly subjected her to late night interrogations and what she describes as an 'exorcism' to rid her of her evil spirits. Her heartbreaking story sheds light on what it's really like to grow up in Scientology, and how it is indeed possible to recover.

Subscribe to @KelliCopter here.

episodes.description:

episodes.title: Why Scientology isn't, and CAN'T BE a Charity in the UK
episodes.description:
The Church of Scientology currently operates in the UK through an Australian-registered company called COSRECI - the Church of Scientology Religious Education College Incorporated. In this video, I look at what it would take for the Church to register as a UK charity, and why it's unlikely to be accepted after their 1999 application was declined.

episodes.title: "Scientology doesn't improve the community" - Why the UK Charity Commission Rejected Scientology
episodes.description:
In 1999, Scientology applied for charity status with the UK's Charity Commission. It was denied on the basis the Church "was not established for the charitable purpose of promoting the moral or spiritual welfare and improvement of the community."
